result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent Lamont Weeden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of following by end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a  civil judgment:  all court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge. 
If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil jugment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent Lamont Weeden in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit; CONCURRENT to Count 1.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 60 DAYS condition time with Huber.  Court stayed commencement until 09/03/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Vincent Lamont Weeden in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 8/19/2015 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Weeden in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Weeden in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Defense counsel received discovery.  Defense counsel requests Status conference.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.   Arraignment NOT held.

Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

As an additional condition of bail:
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No drugs without a valid prescription
No firearms
No dangerous weapons

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Vincent Lamont Weeden in court with Attorney Michael Chernin, appearing for Attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-085

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
